welcome.data: Warm-Up Prompt: “Imagine placing a photo in a frame. What goes around the photo before the frame? What happens if you add space around the frame?” Students brainstorm what margin, padding, and borders might mean in this analogy. Use a Jamboard or whiteboard for sharing.

aim.data: State the agenda and objective: Understand how the CSS Box Model works and how margin, padding, border, width, and height affect layout and spacing.

review.data: Recall how we added style to elements using selectors. Ask: “What happened when you changed width or height of an element last time? Did anything shift?”

relevant.data: Live coding in WebStorm: Create a styled <div> element and walk through margin, padding, border, width, and height. Use browser dev tools to show the box visually.

interactive.data: Students build three styled boxes using CSS. Each box has different margin, padding, border, and dimensions. Inspect behavior in the browser.

ownership.data: Students align boxes in a single row and experiment with spacing. Bonus: design a custom card with creative use of the box model.

resonate.data: Wrap-up discussion: “What’s the difference between margin and padding?” “Why is the box model important?”

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, Chrome/Firefox, box model diagram (optional), CSS cheat sheet for margin/padding/border/width/height
